Definition: Health insurance coverage available (even if not used for payment for a given encounter).

Short: Elements that belong to all information items.
Definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

Short: A human language, spoken or written.
Definition: A human language, spoken or written.

Short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

Short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

Short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
Definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

Short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
Definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

Short: Coverage category such as medical or accident.
Definition: Coverage category such as medical or accident.

Short: Owner of the policy
Definition: Owner of the policy

Short: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.
Definition: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.

Short: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.
Definition: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.

Short: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage., the patient when services are provided.
Definition: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage., the patient when services are provided.

Short: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.
Definition: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.

Short: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.
Definition: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.

Short: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.
Definition: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.

Short: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements.
Definition: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements.

Short: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.
Definition: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.

Short: The priority of the procedure, as a number (1 being the highest priority)
Definition: The priority of the procedure, as a number (1 being the highest priority)

Short: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.
Definition: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.

Short: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been included on the health card. Alternate names include co-pay, deductible, exceptions.
Definition: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been included on the health card. Alternate names include co-pay, deductible, exceptions.

Short: Reimbursement to insurer. When 'subrogation=true' this insurance instance has been included not for adjudication but to provide insurers with the details to recover costs.
Definition: Reimbursement to insurer. When 'subrogation=true' this insurance instance has been included not for adjudication but to provide insurers with the details to recover costs.
